title: Water Filter Compatibility Guide
description: Find the right water filter for your Arco machine. Not every filter fits every model — check compatibility, installation method, and replacement intervals before you buy.
hero_image_alt: Three Arco water filter cartridges of different sizes displayed beside an in-line filter system, with clear water flowing through a transparent housing

filters.name: Arco Standard Water Filter Cartridge
filters.description: Drop-in cartridge that sits inside the water reservoir. Reduces chlorine, limescale, and off-flavours. No tools or plumbing required.

filters.name: Arco Pro Water Filter Cartridge
filters.description: High-capacity ion exchange cartridge for hard water areas (14+ °dH). Reservoir drop-in design with faster flow rate. Replace monthly in hard water.

filters.name: Arco Max Protection Filter System
filters.description: Two-stage in-line filter system. Connects between your water supply and the machine's direct-plumb inlet. Stage 1: sediment and chlorine pre-filter. Stage 2: scale inhibitor cartridge. Professional installation recommended.

filters.name: Arco Taste Optimiser Filter
filters.description: For soft water areas. Minimal hardness reduction; focuses on chlorine removal and mineral balancing for optimal espresso flavour per SCA water standards.

machine_compatibility.installation_notes: Small reservoir. Use the Standard or Taste Optimiser cartridge. Pro cartridge is physically too large for this tank. No direct-plumb option.
Removable 1.2L tank accepts all drop-in cartridges. Drop the cartridge into the tank before filling with water. Replace when the flow indicator turns red.
Generous 1.8L tank. The machine's display will remind you when to replace the filter based on usage tracking. All drop-in cartridges fit.
2L removable tank. For heavy users (5+ cups/day), consider the Pro cartridge and replace monthly. Standard cartridge works well for lighter use.
Dual-feed system: use drop-in cartridges with the tank, or connect the Max Protection in-line system via the rear plumbing port. Plumbing kit sold separately.
1.5L tank behind the group head. Lever machines are especially sensitive to scale in the piston seal area. Use the Pro cartridge in hard water areas.
Large 3L tank or direct plumb. The heat-exchange boiler is the most scale-sensitive in the lineup. The Max Protection in-line system is strongly recommended for water above 14 °dH.
3.5L tank or direct plumb. With two independent boilers, scale protection is critical. Direct plumb with the Max Protection system is the best choice for this machine.
